content.rendered:
From playful to serious we have you covered this week with work from Barcelona, Paris, and Hamburg.

Farmàcia Esplugas by Toormix

Farmàcia Esplugas in Barcelona might have the cutest identity and retail presence of any pharmacy. Designed by local firm Toormix, the identity hinges on a smiling heart made out of the sideways “E” from its wordmark. It’s maybe a little too cute on its own but when put to use in the floor tiles and as a pattern it becomes quite fetching. The identity also features some watercolor drawings, a wide range of icons, and a pattern of apothecary jars. It’s also all maybe a little too much stuff for a single pharmacy but when it’s apparent that both designer and client are having fun, why not? See full project

Popote’s by Violaine & Jérémy

Spotted earlier this week on our own Art of the Menu, the logo for Popote’s — a group of French-born food lovers living in Brooklyn preparing pop-up dinners and catering — caught my eye because it’s the best use of a belly in a logo. Designed by Paris-based Jérémy the illustration of a dapper man that looks exactly like a French-born food lover living in Brooklyn also stands in as a “P” for Popotes (which comes from the French expression “faire la popote”, meaning cooking family style) and it makes for a delightful character. The wordmark has a fun vibe and the “O”s look like dinner plates. And I would take my charcuterie wrapped in that pattern any day of the week. See full project.

GMUND Urban by Paperlux

More stand-alone packaging than full-scale identity this project by Hamburg, Germany-based Paperlux for paper company GMUND’s Urban line has plenty to like. Of particular awesomeness is the copper frame found on the different items that connects all of them together, much like a street in a city. Without the clever photography and proper placement this would probably be a hard read but, on their own, each item in this paper line is beautifully designed with minimal typography letting the sumptuous papers do the heavy lifting. See full project here.
